messages.message:
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05L87V014J/p1734523353655139?thread_ts=1734454478.627989&cid=C05L87V014J

since the sandbox is using a fresh db, you need to create a new account and cannot use your aihub-sandbox credentials

@mfichman it seems that we need to document how to log into your new sandbox in https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yQOCxOISV_ukUxXdPJDoN-rERtOhdVRe7zv1swF1igw/edit?tab=t.0?

also, until we resolve all the issues related to org setup / license setup / etc, it might be worth documenting how to use the dogfood.instabase.com (http://dogfood.instabase.com) db in the setup doc

Hi Serena, as far as I know, there are no license issues with the sandboxes since I added support for post install actions. And I really think we should stop using dogfood. In fact we’re planning to delete it soon! I don’t think we need a separate doc. I will add the instructions for logging in (specifically: not using Google) to the main guide.

I will also add instructions about how to create an org in your personal crafting sandbox. However, for those following this thread, it’s fairly self-explanatory: do what a customer would do to create a commercial trial. I think that if we can’t as engineers figure out how to do that then our product needs work.

ah i didn’t realize you already added support for the ai hub post-install actions!

~does the post-install action also automatically create commercial and enterprise orgs? or do engineers still need to manually do that in their new sandbox?~
covered in your message above
Yes: though if you have a pre-existing sandbox/older sandbox, you might need to run `cs sandbox update` and then `cs build` one time just to make sure that they got run.
@mfichman can you edit your message to `cs sandbox update`
wait it should be `cs sandbox update` and `cs build` I think, not `cs sandbox build`!
Yes, I edited it wrong. Fixed now!
